name: Spark AR Project
summary: Learn about .ARPROJ files and view a list of programs that open them.

content: Spark AR Studio allows Facebook users to create AR effects that they can apply to Facebook and Instagram videos. For example, a Spark AR Studio user could create a "flaming aura" effect and then apply the effect to the people, animals, or items featured in a video.

When a user saves a Spark AR Studio effects project, the program creates a new project directory. This directory contains an ARPROJ file and any assets the user has imported into their project. The ARPROJ file is a record of the edits the user has made to their project. It is the file Spark AR Studio uses to load and display the project.

After a user has finished editing their project in Spark AR Studio, they can export the project as an .AREXPORT file to upload it to Spark AR Hub, the platform from which users access their Spark AR effects. They can also package the project and its included assets as an .ARPROJPKG file, using the File → Package... option.

instructions: You can open an ARPROJ file in Spark AR Studio (cross-platform). To do so, select File → Open... from the program's menu bar. Keep in mind, however, that:
You must have a Facebook account to use Spark AR Studio
Your ARPROJ file will open correctly only if it is stored in a project directory, alongside the project's included assets
